summary: An internal FBI email from July 9, 2019, requesting an update on the status of locating, interviewing, or serving grand jury subpoenas to 10 co-conspirators in the Epstein case. The email indicates the co-conspirators were believed to be located in New York, North Carolina, Boston, and Florida.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: The sender of the email, identified as part of the FBI's Violent Crimes Section, Crimes Against Children Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU), requesting an update on co-conspirators.

events.title: FBI Request for Update on Co-conspirators
events.description: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent emails a request for an update on the status of 10 co-conspirators, specifically regarding how many have been located, interviewed, or served with grand jury subpoenas.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively pursuing 10 co-conspirators in the Epstein investigation as of July 2019.
The co-conspirators were believed to be geographically distributed: 5 in New York, 1 in North Carolina, 1 in Boston, and 3 in Florida.
The update request focused on whether these individuals had been successfully located, interviewed, or served with grand jury subpoenas.
The email originated from the FBI's Violent Crimes Section, specifically the Crimes Against Children Human Trafficking Unit (CACHTU).
The document indicates an active, multi-state investigative effort to secure testimony or cooperation from alleged co-conspirators.
